attributes.action: restrict the vote to those who have contributed to the UK economy through taxes
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: At present, universal suffrage means that everyone has the same right to vote, whether they have paid taxes continuously for forty years, or whether they have never contributed. This is manifestly unfair - why should non-contributors have any say? The proposal is that only those who have paid tax for a minimum of 33% of their working lives (so far) should have the vote. Voting would then be compulsory - a right, and a duty.
